description: men feel cool on horses
Sumerians invent writing, wheel, irrigation; Bronze Age begins.
Egyptian Old, Middle, New Kingdoms build pyramids, conquer Nubia.
Gilgamesh rules Uruk; first epic poem.
Indus civilisation flourishes in modern Pakistan.
Sargon of Akkad conquers Sumeria to form an empire.
Minoans thrive on Crete; Europe’s first major civilisation.
Polynesians settle Pacific islands.
Babylon rises as a key Mesopotamian power.
Hammurabi’s code influences law.
Hittites use iron and fight in chariots.
Shang dynasty is first well-documented Chinese realm.
Mycenaeans control Aegean, speak Greek, worship Greek gods.
Aryans invade India; Hinduism begins with Veda scriptures.
Olmecs sculpt large heads in Mesoamerica.
Assyrian Empire expands in the Middle East.
Phoenicians trade widely, found Carthage.
Greek Dark Ages after Mycenae's fall.
Zhou dynasty longest in Chinese history.
Hebrew King David rules Judah.
Kush kingdom in Nubia conquers Egypt briefly.
Archaic Greece sees city-states flourish, Homer composes epics.
Olympic Games in Greece.
Mayans build major cities in Mesoamerica.
Carthage builds a trading empire until Rome sacks it.
Neo-Babylonian Empire, famed for Hanging Gardens.
Pythagoras shapes early mathematics.
Achaemenid Persia conquers Middle East.
Roman Republic replaces monarchy.
Confucius and Buddha preach in China and India.
Greco-Persian Wars; Greeks defeat Persian invasions.
Classical Greece flourishes under Pericles.
Peloponnesian Wars; Sparta defeats Athens.
Warring States in China ends with Qin unification.
Plato meets Socrates
Roman Twelve Tables codify law.
Herodotus writes Histories.
Celts sack Rome
Aristotle meets Plato and begins to study in Athens
Athens wars with Macedon under Philip II.
Alexander the Great inherits Macedon, conquers vast empire.
Alexander’s generals form successor states like the Seleucids and Ptolemies.
Mauryan Empire unites India and promotes Buddhism.
Euclid writes Elements of geometry.
Archimedes pioneers mechanical inventions.
Colossus of Rhodes stands briefly.
Punic Wars: Rome conquers Carthage, expands empire.
Parthian Empire controls Silk Road, fights Rome.
Eratosthenes measures Earth’s circumference, axis tilt, distances.
Ctesibus invents water-powered pipe organ.
Qin unify China, build Great Wall, Terracotta Army.
Slave revolts and Italian uprising lead to Roman reforms.
Han dynasty battles Xiongnu nomads.
Nazca culture thrives in Peru, create Nazca lines.
First Triumvirate: Pompey, Crassus, Caesar control Rome.
Caesar crosses Rubicon, defeats Pompey, becomes dictator, then assassinated.
Second Triumvirate of Antony, Lepidus and Octavian ends Republic.
Octavian (Augustus) becomes first Roman Emperor.
Jesus of Nazareth is born and crucified in 33 AD.
Rome invades Britain, founds Londinium.
Great Fire of Rome; Nero blames Christians.
Year of Four Emperors.
'Five Good Emperors' rule Rome peacefully.
Roman Empire at greatest extent under Trajan.
Three Kingdoms period in China, constant warfare.
Sassanid Persia wars with Romans, Huns, Turks.
Gupta Empire in India, Golden Age of culture.
Great Migration of barbarian tribes to Western Europe.
African Aksum and Ghana flourish.
Constantine convenes Council of Nicaea, standardising Christian doctrine.
Roman capital moved to Constantinople.
Empire split into East (Byzantine) and West.
Rome sacked by Visigoths, Romans leave Britain.
Western Roman Empire falls to Ostrogoths.
Franks overthrow Rome in Gaul, forming France.
Justinian the Great reconquers parts of the West.
Nika Riots in Constantinople kill tens of thousands.
Plague of Justinian devastates Byzantium, recurs centuries.
Monks smuggle silkworms to Byzantium.
Muhammad born, founds Islam; caliphates arise after his death.
Tibetan Empire often clashes with China.
Tang Dynasty in China sees cultural zenith.
Taika reforms centralise power in Japan.
Khazar Turks rule near Black Sea.
Chinese Imperial Exams create scholar-bureaucrats.

Venice becomes a republic with major naval power.
Muslim conquest of Iberia begins.
Abbasid Caliphate’s Golden Age of Islamic culture.
Vikings raid Europe, settle widely; reach North America.
Charlemagne crowned Holy Roman Emperor.

Byzantine revival under Macedonian dynasty.
Corruption in the Papacy tarnishes its reputation.

Genoa becomes a maritime republic, rival to Venice.

Great Schism splits Eastern Orthodoxy and Roman Catholicism.
Norman conquest of England at Hastings.

Plantagenets rule England until War of Roses.

First bank in Venice; Christian usury ban shifts banking.

Japan under shogunate, samurai rule.
Inca Empire in Andes.

Hundred Years’ War between England and France.

Aztec civilisation in Mexico with elaborate sacrifices.

Magellan’s expedition circumnavigates Earth.

Sack of Rome undermines Papal power.
